title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - Revised
description: Detailed requirements for the CellularAutomatonUniverse project are being gathered and documented. The requirements will include specific cellular automata types (e.g., Conway's Game of Life, Wolfram Rules), scale of simulations (number of cells, grid size, and dimensions for 3D visualizations), desired outputs such as real-time visualizations, data exports in various formats, performance requirements (Frame Per Second (FPS) target, response time), scalability requirements (multi-threading, distributed computing, containerization solutions like Kubernetes and potential use of cloud services), integration with data analysis tools for post-processing of generated data, and additional features or constraints. The aim is to create a versatile, efficient, and extensible simulation platform for complex system modeling, ranging from biological processes to cosmic phenomena. Note that this task may be refined further as more information is gathered. Additionally, it would be beneficial to consider potential integration with machine learning algorithms for pattern recognition and prediction.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture for the CellularAutomatonUniverse project, including the components for simulation, visualization, data storage, and any necessary distributed computing or parallelization strategies.

title: Develop Cellular Automaton Simulation Engine
description: Implement the core simulation engine for cellular automata, capable of handling massive-scale simulations and supporting various types of cellular automata rules and configurations.

title: Implement Data Storage and Management
description: Design and implement a scalable data storage and management system for storing and retrieving simulation data, including support for distributed storage and efficient data access.

title: Develop Visualization and User Interface
description: Create a user interface and visualization components for displaying and interacting with the cellular automaton simulations, including support for various visualization techniques and real-time updates.
